name: Read TIFF image
description: Simle reading a single image from TIFF file.

in_ports.name: file
in_ports.caption: file
in_ports.hint: [Optional] String path to the file. If specified, it is used instead of "File" parameter (with all replacements performed in that parameter).

in_ports.name: input
in_ports.caption: optional input
in_ports.hint: If specified, this function simply returns a copy of this image (other arguments are ignored).

in_ports_hidden.name: close_file
in_ports_hidden.caption: close file
in_ports_hidden.hint: "true"/"false": if "true", the input file will be always closed after executing.

out_ports.name: valid
out_ports.hint:
"true" if the input file is in TIFF format and it was read successfully;
"false" in other case (in particular in a case of some exception).
Note: this flag can be "true" even for an invalid file,
if reading was successful but there are problems in the non-analyzed parts of the file.

out_ports.name: ifd_index
out_ports.hint: Index of currently read IFD (equal to "IFD index" parameter).

out_ports.name: rectangle
out_ports.hint: 4 numbers describing a rectangle that was actually read: min_x, max_x, min_y, max_y.

out_ports.name: absolute_path
out_ports.caption: absolute path
out_ports.hint: Actual full absolute path to the file.

out_ports.name: parent_folder
out_ports.caption: parent folder
out_ports.hint: Absolute path to the parent folder of the file.

out_ports_hidden.name: closed
out_ports_hidden.hint:
Flag true/false: it will be true when the TIFF file was closed by this function, false if it stayed to be opened.
Useful for debugging needs.

controls.caption: File
controls.name: file
controls.description:
You can use here relative paths (without starting "/" or "c:\"), for example, "test.tiff" or "images/test.tiff". They will be resolved relative the current folder, containing the executed chain.
If this path starts with substring %TEMP%, %TEMP%/ or %TEMP%x. where x is OS-depended file separator character, this substring is replaced with the full path to the system temp directory (System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir")) with ending file separator. For example, it is correct to write here %TEMP%my_file.dat, %TEMP%/my_file.dat or (in Windows) %TEMP%\my_file.dat.
Also you can use in this string Java system properties: "${name}", for example: "${java.io.tmpdir}", and executor system properties "${path.name.ext}", "${path.name}", "${file.name.ext}", "${file.name}", "${resources}" (chain path/file name with/without extension, resource folder of the platform, containing this function).

controls.name: fileNameAdditionMode
controls.caption: How to add "file name addition" (for example XXX.DAT)
controls.description: This mode can be used together with input string "file name addition"

items.caption: no correction ("file name addition" is not used)
replace $$$ with the addition, but without its extension: /path/name$$$.ext => /path/nameXXX.ext

controls.caption: Secure mode
controls.name: secure
controls.description: If set, "file name addition" feature and Java system properties in the path are disabled, and the path is checked that it does not contain "suspicious" characters/substring like % (property?), ${... (variable inside a string?). Executor system properties "${path.name.ext}", "${path.name}", "${file.name.ext}", "${file.name}" and starting %TEMP%/ are enabled.

controls.caption: Requires existing file
controls.name: fileExistenceRequired
controls.description:
If set, the input file must exist; in other case, this function will throw an exception.
If this flag is cleared and the file does not exist, this function does nothing (just returns non-initialized result).

controls.caption: IFD index
controls.name: ifdIndex
controls.description: Index of the selected image (IFD) inside the TIFF.

controls.caption: Auto-scale when increasing bit depth
controls.name: autoScaleWhenIncreasingBitDepth
controls.description: Whether do we need to scale pixel sample values when automatic increasing bit depths, for example, when we decode 12-bit grayscale image into 16-bit result. Set to "true" by default.

controls.caption: Auto-correction of inverted brightness
controls.name: autoCorrectInvertedBrightness
controls.description: Whether do we need to invert pixel sample values in color spaces with inverted sense of pixel brightness:  "WhiteIsZero" and "Separated" (CMYK). Set to "false" by default, because this flag does not provide correct processing CMYK and more complex models, it simply helps to see a more realistic result.

controls.caption: Desired number of channels
controls.name: numberOfChannels
controls.description: Allows to specify desired number of channels in the result, for example, automatically remove alpha-channel when it is present (value 3) or convert the result into grayscale image (value 1).
